org.pivot4j.transform

Interface PlaceHierarchiesOnAxes

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Transform
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PlaceHierarchiesOnAxesImpl

    public interface PlaceHierarchiesOnAxes
extends Transform
    Allows to place hierarchies on the visible query axes.

    Use Case.

    • The GUI will examine the result of the olap query to find out which hierarchies are currently displayed on what axes. It will use Axis.getHierarchies() for this.
    • Then it will find out what Hierarchies exist by calling OlapModel.getDimensions() and Dimension.getHierarchies().
    • The Information will be presented to the user and he will be allowed to change the mapping between axes and hierarchies.
    • For every Hierarchy that the user selected for display on an axis, the GUI will call createMemberExpression().
    • For each axis the system will build the the array of memberExpressions and call setAxis once.

    • Method Detail

      • placeHierarchies

        void placeHierarchies(org.olap4j.Axis axis,
                    List<org.olap4j.metadata.Hierarchy> hierarchies,
                    boolean expandAllMember)
        Parameters:
        axis - The target axis
        hierarchies - The hierarchies to put
        expandAllMember - If this flag is set and an "All" member is put onto an axis, the children of the All member will be added as well.

      • addHierarchy

        void addHierarchy(org.olap4j.Axis axis,
                org.olap4j.metadata.Hierarchy hierarchy,
                boolean expandAllMember,
                int position)
        Parameters:
        axis - The target axis
        hierarchy - The hierarchy to add
        expandAllMember -
        position - The position index where to add the hierarchy. Any value less than ZERO will put the hierarchy at the end of the axis.

      • findVisibleHierarchies

        List<org.olap4j.metadata.Hierarchy> findVisibleHierarchies(org.olap4j.Axis axis)
        Collects all hierarchies on a given axis in the result. If no hierarchies are visible, it returns an empty list.
        Parameters:
        axis - the axis to use
        Returns:
        A list of hierarchies
